solution_line_template: First figure out how many silver coins the {gold_coins} gold coins are worth by multiplying the number of gold coins by the exchange rate between gold and silver: {gold_coins} gold * {silver_per_gold} silver/gold = <<{gold_coins}*{silver_per_gold}={gold_value_in_silver}>>{gold_value_in_silver} silver

Then add the value of the gold in silver to the number of silver coins to find the total value of the gold and silver expressed in silver coins: {gold_value_in_silver} silver + {silver_coins} silver = <<{gold_value_in_silver}+{silver_coins}={total_gold_silver_in_silver}>>{total_gold_silver_in_silver} silver

Now multiply that value by the exchange rate between silver and copper to express its value in terms of copper coins: {total_gold_silver_in_silver} silver * {copper_per_silver} copper/silver = <<{total_gold_silver_in_silver}*{copper_per_silver}={gold_silver_value_in_copper}>>{gold_silver_value_in_copper} copper

Then add the value of the gold and silver expressed in copper coins (the value from the last step) to the number of copper coins to find the total value of the hoard: {gold_silver_value_in_copper} + {copper_coins} = <<{gold_silver_value_in_copper}+{copper_coins}={total_hoard_value_in_copper}>>{total_hoard_value_in_copper}
